messages.content: Don't make assumptions about what values to plug into functions. Ask for clarification if a user request is ambiguous.
Current temp Grand Canyon. I can't read Celsius.

I’m sorry—I don’t have real-time weather data built in, so I can’t look up the current Grand Canyon temperature for you. If you see it listed somewhere in Celsius, though, here’s the quick conversion:

°F = (°C × 9⁄5) + 32

Example: 20 °C → (20 × 9⁄5) + 32 = 68 °F

If you find the Celsius reading, plug it into that formula (or let me know the number and I’ll convert it for you).
Yo, can you check it online or something?

I don’t have a live weather-feed connected, so I can’t look up the real-time temperature at the Grand Canyon from inside this chat. If you:

• Open any weather site or app (Weather.com, Weather Underground, NWS, a smartphone weather widget, etc.)  
• Enter “Grand Canyon Village, AZ” (or the nearest rim location you’re interested in)

you’ll get the current temperature—often shown in both °C and °F, or with a settings toggle.

If you only see it in Celsius, send me the number and I’ll convert it to Fahrenheit right away.
Great—just send me the Celsius value once you have it, and I’ll convert it for you.
